visualcryptography.matrix
Class MatrixConstructor

java.lang.Object
  visualcryptography.matrix.MatrixConstructor

public class MatrixConstructor
extends java.lang.Object

MatrixConstructor is used to create the matrix c0 and c1 used for encrypting.

Since:
6.25.05
Author:
Edward P. Legaspi

Constructor Detail

MatrixConstructor

public MatrixConstructor()
Method Detail

gen2x2WhiteBasis

public Matrix gen2x2WhiteBasis()
Constructs the zero-one Matrix c0 for 2x2 Visual Cryptography. Matrix looks like 1 0 0 1 1 0 0 1

gen2x2BlackBasis

public Matrix gen2x2BlackBasis()
Constructs the zero-one Matrix c1 for 2x2 Visual Cryptography Matrix looks like 1 0 1 0 0 1 0 1

gen2xNWhiteBasis

public Matrix gen2xNWhiteBasis(int nShares)
Generates the basis matrix c0 for encrypting the white pixel for the 2xn VCS. Returns a zero-one Matrix that has a (n - 1)Combination(n / 2) columns whose weights are zero and (n - 1)Combination((n / 2) - 1) columns that have weights of n.

gen2xNBlackBasis

public Matrix gen2xNBlackBasis(int nShares)
Generates the basis matrix c1 for encrypting the black pixel for the 2xn VCS. Returns a zero-one Matrix of column weight (n / 2); that has a column nCombination(n / 2).

genNxNWhiteBasis

public Matrix genNxNWhiteBasis(int nShares)
Generates the basis matrix c0 for encrypting the white pixel for the nxn VCS. Creates a zero-one Matrix whose column weights are even.

genNxNBlackBasis

public Matrix genNxNBlackBasis(int nShares)
Generates the basis matrix c1 for encrypting the black pixel for the nxn VCS. Creates a zero-one Matrix whose column weights are odd.

nCr

private int nCr(int n,
                int r)
Returns the combination of n taken r.

factorialN

private int factorialN(int n)
Returns the factorial of a number n.

pixelExpansion2xN

private int pixelExpansion2xN(int n)
Returns the pixel expansion m-columns which is [n Combination (n / 2)].

XRaiseToY

private int XRaiseToY(int a,
                      int b)
Returns the integer value of a raise to b.

getRowWeight

private int getRowWeight(Matrix temp,
                         int row)
Returns the number of ones a column have.

Submit a bug or feature at laizzez_faire07(@)yahoo.com. Visual Cryptography is an implementation of the newly discovered and developed visual encryption algorithm by Naor and Shamir at the Eurocrypt 1994. Copyright 2005 University of the Philippines, Los Ba±os, Laguna. All rights reserved.
